intro: Jurinea moschus subsp. pinnatisecta, commonly known as the fragrant snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its delicate, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has finely divided, pinnatisect leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to harsh alpine conditions. Its fragrant flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it an important species in its ecosystem.
